answers.answer: Hello.Foamy urine is usually caused by proteins. The commonest causes of damage to kidneys causing proteinuria (proteins in urine) are hypertension and diabetes.You can ask your physician to do a 24 hour urine sample testing for proteins. You may also test for fasting and post meal blood sugar. Please get your blood pressure monitored.Do you have an increased frequency of urination ?Regards
Thanks very much proteins tests were negetive, diabetes negetive, BP is normal, I dont complain of any thing,
I dont have increased frequency of urination also I am a sports man playing squash professional level.

question: I stopped sweating even during heavy work  I am 41 . I drink alot of  water. I used to sweat (one month back) alot all over body with little workout . Now after 20 minutes of excercise my face  pain gets hot. I noticed also, my urine is foamy, all blood and urine test are normal. should I worry please help
title: lack of sweating
